Native to the high-altitude regions of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is a climbing shrub that often forms dense foliage, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
